original_solution_mapping.L1: Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends $3000 / 3 = $<<3000/3=1000>>1000 on food.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends $3000 / 4 = $<<3000/4=750>>750 on supplies.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, he spends $3000 - $1000 - $750 = $<<3000-1000-750=1250>>1250 on employee wages every month.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1655.
    Returns: the amount Abe spends on wages.
    """
    # L1
    budget = 3000 # If his budget is $3000
    food_divisor = 3 # a third of his budget on food
    food_cost = budget / food_divisor

    # L2
    supplies_divisor = 4 # a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies
    supplies_cost = budget / supplies_divisor

    # L3
    wages_cost = budget - food_cost - supplies_cost

    # FA
    answer = wages_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends ${budget} / {food_divisor} = $<<{budget}/{food_divisor}={food_cost}>>{food_cost} on food.
He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends ${budget} / {supplies_divisor} = $<<{budget}/{supplies_divisor}={supplies_cost}>>{supplies_cost} on supplies.
Thus, he spends ${budget} - ${food_cost} - ${supplies_cost} = $<<{budget}-{food_cost}-{supplies_cost}={wages_cost}>>{wages_cost} on employee wages every month.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends $3000 / 3 = $<<3000/3=1000>>1000 on food.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends $3000 / 4 = $<<3000/4=750>>750 on supplies.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Thus, he spends $3000 - $3 - $750 = $<<3000-3-750=2247>>2247 on employee wages every month.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'food_divisor' (value: 3) was used instead of 'food_cost' (value: 1000.0).
